channel.title: Reading on Potato
channel.description: Recent content in Reading on Potato

item.title: Year 2038 problem
item.description:
Classic buffer overflow bug

Most computer systems measure unix time- the number of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) â€“ and store it in a signed 32-bit integer However the data type can only store numbers from -(231) and (232 - 1) (random trivia: this number is the eighth Mersenne prime).

item.title: Internet Census 2012
item.description:
Super fast distributed port scanner

Just search up Carna botnet and you’ll be presented with a picture of world map. This is supposed to be the scan result of Carna botnet. The idea of this concept was to measure the extent of internet in what the creator called the Internet Census of 2012. The data was collected by infiltrating Internet devices, especially routers, that used a default password or no password at all. It was named after Carna, the Roman goddess for the protection of inner organs and health.

item.title: Paul Graham and his essays
item.description:
More reading material

Paul Graham best known for his work on Lisp or his former startup Viaweb (later renamed Yahoo! Store) But I got to know about this guy from the essays he’s written and published on his website

You can have a look at the full list from here

I’ve read Good and Bad Procrastination and Trolls
